Unfortunately we know vandalism of school property is an all-too-common problem. From my standpoint as Prime Minister and someone very passionate about a high-quality education, we want kids to have the benefits of all the resources in our schools and we don’t want to see these wanton acts of destruction in any school.

Julia Gillard in response to vandals setting fire to her old school.

This quote highlights the worst thing about Gillard. Every fucking word that comes out of her mouth is monotonous, politicised nothing speak. Kids burnt your school, far out, show some emotion.

It’s just like last week, when she was confronted in a shopping centre by someone with a legitimate question who (unlike most Australians) was well informed on this issue. In my ideal world Gillard would tell the woman, “yes, I said I wouldn’t do this previously but now I have more information, it’s a three year stepping stone and it’s the right thing to do”. Instead she completely ignores the words the woman is saying and just repeats the party line. To her credit the woman doesn’t want any of it and makes the situation awkward.

I can somewhat understand the meaningless political babble being told to the lazy press but when you’re one on one with a voter telling you they understand what the carbon tax is and Gillard just repeats the same “we’re implementing a carbon tax for the 500 big polluters blah blah blah” I question whether she’s actually a robot dressed as a human.
